data.title: Two Beakers
data.statement:
You have two beakers, a small beaker ([[A]] mL volume) and a large beaker ([[B]] mL volume).
Given a list of [[N]] amounts of water, the task is to determine whether it is possible to measure <<EXACTLY>> [[X]] ml water using these beakers for each target [[X]].

NOTE: It's forbidden to pour water from one beaker to another.

<<Example>>: When [[A]]=200, [[B]]=500 and [[X]]=900, you can collect 900 mL water by using the small beaker twice (200 x 2) and larger beaker once (500 x 1), thus print {{POSSIBLE}}.

testCases.title: Simple case 1
testCases.testOut:

POSSIBLE
IMPOSSIBLE
POSSIBLE
POSSIBLE
POSSIBLE

data.stubGenerator:
read a:int b:int
read n:int
loop n read x:int 
loop n write POSSIBLE or IMPOSSIBLE

INPUT
a: Smaller beaker volume[mL]
b: Larger beaker volume[mL]
n: The number of targets
x: The volume[mL] you will check
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: Two space-separated integers for the beaker volumes, [[A]] and [[B]].
<<Line 2>>: An integer [[N]] for the number of volumes of water to measure.
<<Next [[N]] Lines>>: An integer for the volume [[X]] you have to measure.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have two beakers, a small beaker (A mL volume) and a large beaker (B mL volume).
Given a list of N amounts of water, the task is to determine whether it is possible to measure EXACTLY X ml water using these beakers for each target X.

NOTE: It's forbidden to pour water from one beaker to another.

Example: When A=200, B=500 and X=900, you can collect 900 mL water by using the small beaker twice (200 x 2) and larger beaker once (500 x 1), thus print POSSIBLE.
Input
Line 1: Two space-separated integers for the beaker volumes, A and B.
Line 2: An integer N for the number of volumes of water to measure.
Next N Lines: An integer for the volume X you have to measure.
Output
N lines: A single word, POSSIBLE or IMPOSSIBLE.
Constraints
1≤A<B≤1,000
1≤N≤10
1≤X≤10,000
Example
Input
3 4
6
3
4
5
6
7
8
Output
POSSIBLE
POSSIBLE
IMPOSSIBLE
POSSIBLE
POSSIBLE
POSSIBLE
